name: 6 Micro NFC Tags 15.6mm X 6mm - 144 Bytes NTAG213, Compatible with all NFC-capable phones
details: Tiny Micro NFC NTag213 only 15.6mm X 6mm
144 bytes or rewrite-able and optionally password protected or permanently lockable storage
Great for embedding into 3D Printed Projects
Works with all NFC enables Phones
short-reviews: I purchased this item to place in my own bent ...
Doesn't work for my project, but great tags nonetheless
long-reviews: I am using one of these, glued inside of my ring, to open a Samsung Ezon deadbolt style door lock. Works great!A similar item on adafruit is $20 ea.
I purchased this item to place in my own bent wood ring and it works as advertised.  I've used it in multiple projects and I've had no problems with it.

These work pretty well, i can read them from my Google Pixel XL through an otterbox case, but they need ro be within roughly 5mm of the case. I think that's pretty acceptable, especially for the size of the tags.What i wanted to do with the tags was to glue them to a ring and use that to unlock my phone. Unfortunately though, the curvature made the tag very difficult to read with the phone case on and had something like a 10% success rate for reading. I have now repurposes them for use elsewhere and I really like them.My first batch had 5/6 dead tags. If you get dead tags just message the company and they will send you out new ones, very great customer service.
These tags worked as advertised.  I used one in an MFC ring without any problems.
